lines.text:
[Getting away from his love grip]
You smell like a gutter.
I just came from one.

[Pawing her]
You smell like an animal. And you act like one.
And you love it.

[Clutching Jeff]
No, Jeff! No. Don't go. I'm desperate! I need you. Help me. Help me!

[Releases her]
I'm sorry for you, but I can't help you.
You mean you won't. You don't want to. Why?
I mean this time I'm helping myself.
That's not the reason, you know it. What is it, that girl? No, it can't be. You're not in love with her.
Well, now that I hear you say it, I think I am.
Well, you can't. I won't let you. You belong with me and you're going to stay with me.
You're wrong. On both counts.

[Confronting Marina]
What have you done, Marina?
I committed murder to get you. Murder!
You killed Paco?
I did it for you, don't you understand? I did it for you!

[Choking her]
You killed Paco. You killed him!
[He catches himself and releases her]
Makes me sick even to look at you.
You'll never get away from me. I'll never let you go. I'll say you helped me. I'll say I killed him and you helped me. I don't care if they hang me just so they hang you, too!
Oh, boy!
[Holds his stomach]
Listen to those ulcers growl. Sound like a Great Dane in there. Wish one'd come by so I could eat it...
[Holding his stomach]
Good morning, mister.
What do you want?
You haven't struck oil yet, senor.
What's it to you?
I only wish to tell you. It's dangerous.
Why?
They blow up many wells.
Oh, I see.
Perhaps the mister wants to prevent bandits from blowing up this well?
That'd be pretty hard to do. We have no guns.
You don't need a gun.
We also have no money.
Not even some money? Some little kind of money? Can't you get some? You got no friends? Who told you to dig here?
I bought a lease.
Ha! Then you have money and I want it!
Oh, why'd they have to do it to us? We save every nickel to sink this well and now look at us. Ain't nothing left. Just nothing.
There's still oil here and we're going to dig it out.
How? What with? Where are we gonna get a drill pipe, tools and a new rig? Where? Where?
We'll get us a job, save up and try it again.
I'm sick and tired of trying. It it ain't floods or tornados, it's salt water or bandits. I'm just plain tired.
It's a long way back to town. Let's go.
I ain't going!
[He follows Jeff anyway]

[after Marina lays a wad of cash at the blackjack tail]
That's a pretty big bet.
I'm Marina Conway. I'd like to ask you a question, Miss...?
Donnelly.
I'd appreciate a frank answer.
Certainly, Mrs. Conway.
Is Jeff Dawson in love with you?
I don't mind admitting I'm in love with him.
That's not what I asked.
I can't answer for him.
You could if he loved you.
[Starts to leave]
Thanks, you've told me what I want to know.
Mrs. Conway. He's not in love with you. Not any more.
He tell you that?
He didn't have to.
You're a liar, a cheap little liar. What can he see in you?
I'll ask him next time.
There won't be many more next times. Remember that.

[to his wife, Marina]
I just left Jeff. He's not coming back and there's nothing you can do. He's gone. So that leaves just you and me and this here pump. I can't stop you from loving him, and you can't stop me from love you.
Can't live with a snake by feeding him honey.
Why do you always fight me?
You have a husband.
You could've been my husband. Why aren't you?
Because you're no good, Marina.
I know. I wasn't always this way. With you it was different. You brought out everything decent in me. I wanted to be decent. When you walked out, you stole my chance.
You have 18 wells. I want $1,000 for each well. Total - $50,000.
[laughs]
I don't know how to add.
